doc.field: Series IV. Architecture & New York City-related Exhibitions
Series IV. Architecture & New York City-related Exhibitions
Marilyn Symmes collection of art exhibition ephemera
Marilyn Symmes collection of art exhibition ephemera

Includes material from architectural and New York City related shows and programs at the following museums, spaces, and galleries: National Academy Museum & School, National Building Museum, The Odeon, PaineWebber Art Gallery, The Queens Museum, The Skyscraper Museum, SITE, Smithsonian Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum, Spoleto Festival U.S.A. (Charleston), University of Michigan Museum of Art, The Wallach Art Gallery, and Yale School of Architecture. Also includes National Building Museum brochures from its exhibitions, "On the Job: Design and the American Office (2000)", "On Track: Transit and the American City (2002)", and "The Turner City Collection: Rendering a Century of Building (2002)". Includes information sheets from the Queens Museum on its exhibitions: "The Panorama of the City of New York". "Relief Map of New York City's Watershed", "The Marvel of New York City's Water Supply System", and "Never Built New York". Includes reprints and information on SITE. Includes information on the Cooper-Hewitt's exhibitions, "Masterpieces from the Vitra Design Museum: Furnishing the Modern Era (2000)", "Aluminium by Design: Jewelry to Jets (2001)", and "New Hotels for Global Nomads (2002)". Includes a program from Spoleto Festival U.S.A. on its exhibition, "Places with a Past: New Site-Specific Art in Charleston". Includes a Yale University brochure on its exhibition, "Pedagogy and Place: Celebrating 100 Years of Architecture Education at Yale".
Marilyn Symmes collection of art exhibition ephemera
